website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for aquarium owners who want to create a live aquascape in their tanks, provided the plants are healthy on arrival.
pros: Low maintenance and easy to anchor
Hardy once it's established, and produces vivid dark green leaves
"Clean" – doesn't tend to cause murky water
cons: While many happy customers love this aquatic fern, several received plants that were dry, brown, or dead on arrival

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more pleased with this beautiful, healthy plant that was nicely packaged and quickly shipped to my home. I took it out of its sealed bag, rinsed it off, and placed it in my betta's bowl. The coconut shell that it is growing on serves as a nice anchor under the gravel. My fish,Sky seemed noticibly pleased with this new addition and has been blowing bubble nests ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Green, healthy looking plant
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this 1 week ago for $6.99. I don't remember the width but the height is 5". It came with the coconut shell attachment, has 13 leaves, none are brown or dead. Fits nicely in the center of my new 55 gal tank. Which is still a work in progress. Besides this, I ordered a set of moss balls by the same company. All green and looks nice. I was going to order more Java Ferns but the price hiked to $8. So I waited for the price to come back down and tonight I see it back to $6.99. So I purchased 2 more Java Ferns and another set of moss balls. I do recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous T.

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am completely unsatisfied with this product. It came half dead and when I opened the package come broken. I would not recommend buying this. The photos shown look lush and green but what I received was not what I expected. **********EDIT********** The seller contacted me and gave me another plant free of charge. This plant was better and was all green. I am happy now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to My Tank
customer_reviews.text: These plants are great additions to my tank. When I first got them they appeared like they have seen better days(but that's what you get when you order plants online). Once I put them in my tank they did fine and are flourishing. My ghost shrimp love them. Would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Smith

customer_reviews.title: healthy plant highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Java fern plant is large And healthy (4-5"). Absolutely LOVE it! Strong root system anchored to. Coconut shell which easily stayed in fluorite soil. Highly recommend to new planted aquarium owners!
customer_reviews.author: 100acre Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great company to work with
customer_reviews.text: This is a worthy company. The day before the plant arrived, they asked for my opinion. The plant I received came to me dead, so I emailed them back with pictures of the plant. No questions, no quibbling, they sent me a new and healthy plant. My tank is happy and clean. The new plant is of good size and my fish love swimming through the long leaves. I definitely will do business with this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Storm

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! This came packaged relatively well. I rinsed well and treated with 1 1/2 cup bleach in 1 gal of water for 5 mins- rinsed- soaked 5 mins in water with dechlorinzation solution- rinsed again to kill any snails/eggs then added to tank. My only regret is that I didn't buy two. It's only been one day so if anything changes I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Cynbad Is Bad

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much dead while arrived. (company will send you a new one if this happens though it seems)
customer_reviews.text: Just dark brown and gross when it arrived. Saddest aquarium plant I've ever bought doubt it will even last a few days. Pretty much dead on arrival. *update* I've been trying to revive the plant and it is not coming back. Into the trash it goes. Not heard anything back from seller. Wasted money. UPDATE i have been busy and missed their comments on my review they said they would fix the issue. So i'm updating my review because it seems they will ship you a new plant if yours comes out looking like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Givens

customer_reviews.title: Very nice plant, especially for an on-line purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very nice plant, especially for an on-line purchase! This is my first on-line "live plant" purchase for my freshwater aquarium and I'm impressed with the quality of the plant. The plant came with more stems than I expected, as seen in the pics. The soda can will give you a perspective of the plant's height and width. I purchased only 1 plant because I wanted to see if the quality was as good or better than the large popular store front pet stores. The quality of the plant exceeded my expectations so I will be purchasing a few more from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: TX_Storm

customer_reviews.title: I received this plant in much less than good condition (see first three pictures)
customer_reviews.text: As stated in my seller review, I received this plant in much less than good condition (see first three pictures). I received the same product only a week before in excellent condition (see fourth picture). Therefore, only giving 3 stars. That being said, the firsts plant seems to be doing quite well in our tank. The crummy one, I've trimmed the leaves and am still 'cleaning/soaking' it in distilled water. I plan to put it in the tank tonight. :|
customer_reviews.author: regisk59

customer_reviews.title: Healthy looking plant
customer_reviews.text: Just received my plant via mail and looks very healthy and robust. Just as a precaution I doused the leaves in a 1% bleach water to remove any possible eggs attached to the leaves. I'm keeping this seller as a fav
customer_reviews.author: WarrenD

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: I got the Java fern yesterday and it came completely bunched up in the envelope (attaching pictures) and has several brownish leaves. I washed and placed in my aquarium and added flourish but it still looks as if it's dying. Hope it gets better. Update: the company contacted me and explained that sometimes this happens due to the packaging company and refunded me the money I paid for it so 5 stars for awesome service. I plan to buy the plant again if the one I got doesn't recover. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Anindita

customer_reviews.title: Versitile, just drop it in the tank and viola!
customer_reviews.text: I love this plant. All I did was drop it in the tank. It is very healthy an it is already spawning. I was worried about taking care of real aquatic plants, because I have only ever had house plants. Between learning how to take care of a Betta, (which I was under the impression would be way more simple than it is) and becoming a chemistry major in order to have a good tank environment, I was nervous that learning about taking care of aquatic plants would be one more thing on my plate, but not with this plant.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Gee Bee

customer_reviews.title: This plant is not black.  If it arrives black it is dead.  Mine was dead.
customer_reviews.text: My Luffy moss and other live plants have always arrived in good condition but this plant arrived completely black. The instructions said to remove all black plant matter before putting it in your tank so I removed the disintegrated ends and put in my tank to see if it would make a comeback. It did not. One week later is was molding everything around it and I had to throw it out when I cleaned the tank. I will say my Betta appeared to enjoy gliding through the dead black plant but it was dissolving.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Foushee

customer_reviews.title: Finally found what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: These are really lovely plants which look great in my brackish water tank. it is hard to find live plants that survive in this environment, but these seem to be doing fine. I also bought the Marimo Balls and they are also okay. They have helped to eliminate the excess phosphates in my tank which were causing high amonia levels. I will review again in a few months to advise whether they produce new growth, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Turn Around
customer_reviews.text: When I got this, I was nervous it wouldn't make it. it had one 90% dead leaf and one entirely dead leaf. It also had a severely creased leaf that I thought was just going to crack off. All the leaves were pushed to one side because of its packaging. BUT after some love and carbon it seems to have made a comeback. The creased leaf is getting a bit better, the plants one-sidedness is now beginning to strengthen out into a natural upright shape and new leaves have grown. And of course my fish love it.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Stamathis

customer_reviews.title: Why is this so highly rated?!  Mine arrived quick yet brown!!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my fern an hour ago, looking at other reviews and that I see my plant is not the lovely green fern as advertised. Wasn't sure if the brown was natural or not lol but guess it's probably dead. I'll try to get another maybe or something, i doubt this will make it, but i should've looked at the lower reviews here rather than the 5 star reviews. How did it die in 2 days?! Here's to hoping.
customer_reviews.author: adam swanson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all around beginner plant
customer_reviews.text: Java ferns are a very nice beginner plant for those just starting in the aquarium hobby. They make a perfect background plant as they are tall and provide and great place for top, mid, and low level swimming fish to hid in. These plants came perfectly lush and green and came in a big bundle, more then what I would get in a pet store. After a couple months of having java ferns I have actually become annoyed with how fast these plants reproduce. I don’t know what to do with all these java ferns.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: Healthy & Clean
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this plant - so much so that I placed a second order. Both orders arrived very quickly. The plants were in amazing shape - not wilted or dirty. They were so clean all I did (after thoroughly inspecting them for any unwanted riders - I found none) was rinse them and place them in my tank. I had the first plant for a couple of weeks before placing the second order. They're both doing great! One plant arrived with 10 long (10"+) healthy stems. The second one arrived with 12 long (10"+) healthy stems. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: CenCalGirl

customer_reviews.title: Lame
customer_reviews.text: One of them came nice and green but still has brown spots on it and the other is completely dead and brown. I haven't even removed it from the bag; it will be returned asap. I was expecting two to put in my tank and later to buy more for my other tanks, but oh well. I also have prime so what on earth happened? I won't be ordering from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: sara a.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase from LUFFY and I must say I am completely impressed. To be able to order live plants online and have them actually arrive alive just blows my mind. Product came within 2 days, was packaged nicely. Absolutely no leaves were brown or dead. There was about 15 leaves on my particular fern and was about 5in tall. It's been in my aquarium since I ordered and is growing beautifully still attached to the coconut shell. I have aspirations of ordering from this company in the near future. What a lovely and convenient world we live in.
customer_reviews.author: Alecia

customer_reviews.title: Have gotten a couple of these and love having them to provide a plant with a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Have gotten a couple of these and love having them to provide a plant with a bit of height. One thing to take note of is just because leaves turn brown does not mean the plant is dying. New buds grow out of the leaves from browning portions. It also is fairly slow to grow but once it starts budding more will keep popping out at a decent rate.
customer_reviews.author: Masblue

customer_reviews.title: Came half dead, but rejuvenated in a few weeks of care.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very orange and brown, Java Fern is easy to grow, a very undemanding plant, after some love and care I got this plant back to pristine conditions. This plant is rooted into a piece of coconut. It is still rooted months later in that shell. It is a small plant, I had to trim dead leaves off of it and that made it look even smaller.. All in all I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Summers

customer_reviews.title: All leaves were a nice color and didn't require any trimming
customer_reviews.text: This is my first live plant for my 2.7 gallon betta tank. Arrived quickly and well packaged. All leaves were a nice color and didn't require any trimming. I almost ordered two plants but I'm glad I only did one, the one I got is pretty big. Luckily my tanker is taller than it is wide. If it was a long, short tank, the leaves would definitely be above the water line. My betta seems to be enjoying swimming through the leaves.
customer_reviews.author: KayLoraine

customer_reviews.title: Was probably lovely and perfect before packed with a case of canned dog food
customer_reviews.text: The plant itself at one point was healthy and lush. Sadly, the packaging was stunningly stupid. It was thrown in, completely unprotected, in a box with a heavy case of canned dog food. Needless to say, after cutting off most of the broken and smashed leaves, its a sorry little plant in my tank. Can't fault the seller. The item originally was most likely beautiful (I can only imagine) and the instructions were great. I gave the shipping and packaging poor ratings of course.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Good, strong plant!
customer_reviews.text: Highest quality plant I have purchased for my tank so far and I have bought a lot of plants over the years. Beats anything you can find at the large chain pet stores. Lots of good, strong, large, green leaves. I like that it has an anchor. My fish like to uproot plants from time to time. So far so good. Going to order a few more today. YAY!
customer_reviews.author: ThisAndThat

customer_reviews.title: buying live aquatic plants through the internet is probably not the best idea in retrospect
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, buying live aquatic plants through the internet is probably not the best idea in retrospect. I followed all directions and the plant arrived looking dead and never resuscitated. I tossed it, as I didn’t feel like dealing with a return.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Original shipment was not good, but the vendor made up for it - 5 stars now!
customer_reviews.text: So.... the description says each plant comes with 15 leaves and mine came with only 6. A little disappointing for the money I paid. [UPDATE] 05/11/2017: Changing my review to 5 stars. I was contacted by the vendor and they sent me a free replacement plant. Very nice and matched the Amazon description. That was a few months ago, and the plants are doing very well in my African Cichlid aquarium. Will be buying more. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: zablalbaz

customer_reviews.title: Think twice before buying "live" organisms via mail.
customer_reviews.text: Sadness. Arrived DOA and BROWN. Very, very, VERY brown. It gets one star because 1) you can't give zero stars and 2) the company made me laugh with the "Share the joy" and "Happiest in the World" inscriptions on the label. Nothing says joy and happiness like death in a box. Our fish will not be making a bubble nest of joy or happiness today.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopperMom

customer_reviews.title: Good temporary plant
customer_reviews.text: You have to understand that what you are buying is temporary. It is pretty up until it dies. It lasts about 6 weeks in total with degradation beginning at about 4.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Pence-Askin

customer_reviews.title: Plant arrived completely brown
customer_reviews.text: I just received my java fern in the mail and every single leaf is brown, some were even falling off the plant. I'm incredibly disappointed with this product. Why would they send me a dead plant? I'm hoping this is a mistake and they will make it right by sending me an alive/green one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived brown and dead
customer_reviews.text: Plant arrived looking like some kind of compost. I carefully cut open the package and gently removed the plant. All the leaves stayed on the plastic packaging. Laughably, the instructions said to "cut off any brown leaves." I wouldn't buy these plants again, and I recommend that you don't in the first place...
customer_reviews.author: Rilodile

customer_reviews.title: Nice plant
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I got the Java fern a couple days ago and I like it. Not a huge selection of brackish anything where I live so plants are hard to get. Found d this one and it arrived in great shape, and I even ordered a second one
customer_reviews.author: Brad davis

customer_reviews.title: Of course Amazon is awesome and refunded me but I would like to point ...
customer_reviews.text: Plant arrived dead as other reviews stated. To elaborate, not just brownish or weak, but completely, absolutely, irrecoverably, falling apart dead and smelly leaves. Of course Amazon is awesome and refunded me but I would like to point out that anyone who actually just LOOKED at the item could see it was very, very dead. Very, very disappointing....
customer_reviews.author: doggysca

customer_reviews.title: Plants arrived black and dead
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 plants, both arrived very black and brown, all leaves were brittle. I am afraid they were dead already. A few days in aquarium did not restore them but only damage the chemical balance. Everyone should be careful to directly put those suspicious plants into your aquarium. I checked the recent reviews and it seems all of them are negative reviews. I suggest all potential buyers to carefully check the status of the most recent reviews until you see some positive ones come back, otherwise skip these plants.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Java fern
customer_reviews.text: Very upset, my plant looks like it passed though a sick old ladies stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good plant
customer_reviews.text: Update: after the first plant arrived in poor shape the company quickly contacted me and sent me a new plant. The new plant is beautiful! Updated to 5 stars for customer service. Arrived in rough shape. A wee bit smaller than I had measured out, but that's not too huge of a deal. Just rinsed thoroughly and placed in the tank to hopefully have it perk up. Will update with any issues as they arise.
customer_reviews.author: Dae

customer_reviews.title: Decaying Plant Delivered
customer_reviews.text: When the plant arrived, it was dark green (almost brown) and did not look like the photo. Since it was my first aquarium plant, I did not know any better and put it in the fish tank. After about a week, the plant was droopy and eventually the leaves started to fall apart. The nitrite levels in my tank spiked to dangerous levels and I had to throw the decaying plant away.
customer_reviews.author: Augz

customer_reviews.title: DEAD ON ARRIVAL
customer_reviews.text: This was the 2nd time that I purchased this plant. I repurchased since the 1st one was perfect. This was dead on arrival. Advertising says the plant will come with at least 10 leaves. Dead or alive, I can't count 10 leaves. It was black/dark brown vs green and the leaves were coming apart. This was long dead and they still shipped it to me. What's worse is that they actually want me to ship it back to get a refund? That's not right.
customer_reviews.author: theclutch

customer_reviews.title: Better than the moss
customer_reviews.text: These java ferns are faring slightly better than the moss i ordered, but nothing to write home about. At least they didnt arrive dead. Update: After a bit of time, this plant has maintained its nice green color, and is now reproducing. I am quite happy with this situation, and recommend their java ferns.
customer_reviews.author: Thor Allen

customer_reviews.title: Brown spots on the leaves
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time. The leaves extended between 8 and 10 inches high, and the roots were tied to a curved piece of coconut shell. The plant has several brown spots everywhere that don't wash off, but I am hoping that doesn't mean anything bad. I'm going to check my water chemistry in a few days to see if anything is affected though.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Delighted
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about whether mail order live plants would be viable. Every aspect of this purchase far exceeded my expectations. The packaging was careful and robust. The instructions complete and clear. The plants themselves were and in perfect condition --- aquarium ready. I will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: David Van De Voort

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time with these. Go to the other Java Fern seller.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2. 1 arrived completely brown with about 9 leaves. The other super dark green/almost brown with about 15 leaves. I have had them for about 2 weeks now and I am still hoping they come back to life but I am afraid 1 if not both are dead. Additionally, they did not come on coconut husk, they came on big ugly blocks of wood. I have ordered 2 other Java ferns from the other seller on Amazon and they are doing great. Big bright green leaves and reproducing a lot. Don't waste your time with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful live aquarium plant
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful plant and one of the cheaper ones I can find online or at stores. I've had this plant about a month now and I love it. It came with only a small amount of browning on a couple leaves. The past week I had to completely empty out my aquarium and I had this plant only half in water for several days and it did just fine. I plan on buying one or two more.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: My first bad experience.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to write bad reviews normally. I'm more of a see the good in everything type. I ordered 2 plants Java Ferns and was going to add them in my 125. Got them today and opened immediately. One plant was fairly green with some spots but no big deal. The other was completely brown and leaves were fallen off. I've attached a pic. I added some fertilizer for it in hopes to bring it back. Fingers crossed but I think this ones flatlined.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good size plant for 10 gallons
customer_reviews.text: There were a few brown leaves but overall was in great condition. Fish seem to enjoy it. Rinsed it really well before putting it in because it had a very strong odor. Has a nice base that won't stay down on its own but is easily disguised and held down with gravel. I have a huge bowl that holds 10 gallons and I feel like it's a good size for this size bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Lisamay

customer_reviews.title: Our fish seems to like it, but it never bounced back as others ...
customer_reviews.text: This plant came in sub par condition and has not done well in the fish tank. Our fish seems to like it, but it never bounced back as others have mentioned, and has only further started to decay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thrives in my 10 gallon tank!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this aquarium plant a year ago and it’s been wonderful! Looked good when it arrived and is thriving in my tank (10 gallon fresh water tank with a beta, 2 Kori’s, and some neon tetras) . The fish love it too! They’re constantly swimming through, under, over, and chilling next to it. My beta likes to rest on top of the leaves. It has grown quite a bit since I bought it and I’ve actually had to trim it back a few times because it’s gotten so much bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Crabb

customer_reviews.title: A very easy, low mainteneance, and lovely plant for any tank.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very beautiful plant that requires little to no maintenance for the busy aquarium enthusiast. The coconut piece makes a nice and easy anchor to bury into the gravel/sand without the need to completely submerge the roots. It does start out on the smaller side so for bigger tanks you may want to consider more than one to get things rolling. One fits perfectly for my tank. It came with practically zero discoloration and perked right up after about three days. A very nice and simple plant for an easy live plant aquarium setup.
customer_reviews.author: Noctis_the_King

customer_reviews.title: Arrived not too healthy... then turtle ate it.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived fairly quickly, but we had to trim most of the leaves due to being brown, which left is with only one large leaf and perhaps a smaller one. It could've been due to warm weather, or maybe I just got a poor specimen. I had hopes that it would grow back and look nice, but my turtle didn't give it a chance... He quickly chewed it down to nothing. My rating is based on the condition it arrived, not because the turtle ate it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived promptly but it looks like it has been in storage for a long time ...
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived promptly but it looks like it has been in storage for a long time - all of the leaves are fading to brown and dying. The plant was tied to the coconut husk with fishing line but the plant had not anchored itself yet. Be wary Update: Marimo Pet Company reached out to me and sent me a living plant :) Thanks for making things right Marimo Co.!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this plant but unfortunately it was dead on arrival, even though the shipping speed was quick. When I opened the package, the entire plant was brown, not a spec of green on it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ryans

customer_reviews.title: Only 2 of the leaves where partially green (just the ...
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 of the leaves where partially green (just the tips). The rest arrived completely dead. I saved a couple and put them in a glass jar. But definitely not worth buying online.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: not like the picture
customer_reviews.text: The plant only lasted a few days. It was dark brown to begin with, not like the picture. After a partial water change, the plant pretty much denigrated.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Got a lot smaller after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Decent plant. Came with a few brown leaves, but the rest were healthy. Half a year later & most of the big leaves have died off. it used to take up most of my betta's bowl, but now it's a tiny little plant. I guess the leaves die off faster than the baby leaves can grow? I hope the rest of the leaves don't die, because my betta really loves swimming around & resting on the leaves. The top pic is the plant now, the bottom was right after I groomed it & put it in the bowl in June
customer_reviews.author: Enjoying the Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Speedy and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Plant arrived completely dead and falling off of shell. However, I contacted LUFFY immediately and they were going to send me a new one at no charge, but I requested a refunded instead. Speedy and great customer service. I'm still using them for other purchases, just not live plants until the weather gets warmer again. Will try again for the Java Fern in the spring :)
customer_reviews.author: Jade Milbrandt

customer_reviews.title: most like caused by shipping
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time double bagged; second bag contained the still moist, huge Java fern along with instructions on the bag. It was securely attached with clear fishing line to thr coconut shell. Most leaves were in healthy condition with a couple that had very minimal brown spots. One leaf had a broken stem, most like caused by shipping. Over a month later it's thriving and is a beauty deep green color. Also, there were no hitchhiking snails! Overall, I'm very happy with it and I'm thinking of ordering a few more plants in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Never took to the tank
customer_reviews.text: The plant arrived brown and slimy, but we hoped it would take anyway. It did not. It never changed from it's brown slimy form, and eventually it just fell apart in the tank and all that was left was a coconut shell. We bought other moss that worked well, this was a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like how it is attached to the coconut shell
customer_reviews.text: First time purchasing an aquarium plant online. I like how it is attached to the coconut shell. Makes it easy to keep under the gravel. It is thriving and even has produced an offspring plant on one of the leaves.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Didn't ship well
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived brown, it was in my tank immediately upon receiving. Leaves have melted away in 3 days.although still moist and not open, this item must have gotten too hot. Would not again
customer_reviews.author: George Muscat

customer_reviews.title: another DEAD live plant...
customer_reviews.text: arrived all but dead... planted in aquarium, but don't expect it to revive, way too far gone
customer_reviews.author: Kent Angel

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.text: The plant came in a plastic bag that should have been at least damped but was totally dry. We went ahead and put in the fish tank and within 2 days the water was merky and smelly. The plant fell apart and all the disintegrated plant leaves clogged up the filter. It sure did not look like the picture advertised. I do not recommend at all. Hopefully my fish doesn't die
customer_reviews.author: Keri Ernst

customer_reviews.title: The price is better than in any store I can find
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I expected buying aquarium plants online, but I was surprised! They came quickly, in tact, and healthy. Some of the leaves have died off, but the plant is still growing and creating new leaves. The price is better than in any store I can find.
customer_reviews.author: Camanda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in plant order
customer_reviews.text: My plant arrived quickly, 2 days as stated. Every one of the leafs has big brown spots all over them. It looks like something has been eating the leaves. I am totally disappointed. I wanted a healthy, green little plant for my aquarium. I trimmed it, but it's not perking up. I do not recommend buying this plant.
customer_reviews.author: TDA

customer_reviews.title: ... same time and when they came in they looked like they were dead through the packaging
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a couple different ferns at the same time and when they came in they looked like they were dead through the packaging. When I opened them up they looked like they might have had a little life left in them so I decided to see if I could bring them around. Haven’t had any luck with it but I did get some anacharis around the same time from elsewhere that’s doing good.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Now my Tank has Snails
customer_reviews.text: Plant is nice and growing well. I planted mine directly into my substrate and removed the coconut shell and fishing line. But if a downside, it gave my tank snails. They're small, dark, and have a pointed spiral. I don't really want snails but now I do and they multiply fast.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Brown town
customer_reviews.text: I guess I'm one of the unlucky ones. The plant I received was completely brown in arrival. It didn't look anything like any of the photos posted here.
customer_reviews.author: Anna B

customer_reviews.title: Half dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in questionable health. Will see if it survives. Bits were falling off it in swaths which made my pleco happy to eat but I hope it doesn't die. Update: Still not doing well, unsure if it is dead or dying but LUFFY contacted me and offered a refund so customer service is on point.
customer_reviews.author: Dot

customer_reviews.title: Just ok. Tall leaves. Mostly acceptable.
customer_reviews.text: Plant was much larger than expected. Totaling 7 leaves and around 8-10” tall. Not nearly as dence and green as pictured. A lot of brown and yellow spotting. Packaging was nice air cushion surrounding plant. Mostly happy with purchase. Just wish I would have gotten a better plant.
customer_reviews.author: 06ajtayl

customer_reviews.title: Much different experience than a majority of the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Plant arrived today and instructions say to clean in water and trim off broken or brown/black leaves. 3 stems were bare, a couple of the leaves had holes which appear to be caused by something eating them and all the leaves are brown/black. I sent an email and am waiting to hear back to see if company will send a replacement
customer_reviews.author: ViennaTurtles

customer_reviews.title: Too tasty to last
customer_reviews.text: Great plant, too tasty for my fantail goldfish. They ate the whole thing in a couple of weeks, and made a big mess in the tank, with little bits of leaves stuck in the filter, and floating around. It looked great in my small 10 gal tank. So you're warned: if you have goldfish in your tank, they will not make it last very long.
customer_reviews.author: G. Termini

customer_reviews.title: It looks like a dead
customer_reviews.text: The leaves were all brown. With one gentle wash more than half of the leaves came into my hand. It looks like a dead plant
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smelly, slimy and brown falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Smelly, slimy and brown falling apart not willing to put in my tank to see if it recovers. This was dead and rotting long before it shipped.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: They came brown and lopsided doesnt even look good in my tank I threw them out.
customer_reviews.author: Mervé Sip

customer_reviews.title: It arrived black in color. Read the reviews it’s ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived black in color . Read the reviews it’s supposed to be green . Waiting for it too grow...it’s actually disintegrating can I just get another one ! All the reviews said it’s supposed to be green ! Mine is the only one that looks dead , must be dead ! Don’t want to waste my time mailing it ! How can you mail a dead aquatic plant !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice plant and very easy so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This is the first live plant I've ever tried in an aquarium, so I really didn't know what to expect when I ordered through the mail. It arrived looking very healthy, and with no obvious snails or anything else attached. The photos I have attached aren't great, but you can probably see that the size is very good for a tall 5 gallon. It's perfect for me that it is growing on the coconut shell, which also keeps it from floating around. If I had to do much more than place it in the tank, I probably wouldn't have bothered.
customer_reviews.author: spence0470

customer_reviews.title: Snail warning.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful plant, we are pleased with it in our aquarium. Do beware of the snails, we had two on ours that we didn't notice. They will reproduce and take over your tank if you aren't careful.
customer_reviews.author: Chireg

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived colored brown. Not as pictured. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived colored brown. Not as pictured. I don’t know if it is dead or what. Two long leaves and three short ones attached to base.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Disgusting!!! How can they send this to someone. It literally was delivered 5-10 min ago and i opened it right away. The plant I received was wilted, smelled bad and had mold. I received something that was almost black. I wish I could give it 0 stars. Photos attached.
customer_reviews.author: bfn236

customer_reviews.title: I used that email to let them know of the second one being in bad shape,
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair, one was vibrant and healthy, the other not so much, Luffy had sent me care instructions, I used that email to let them know of the second one being in bad shape,, They took care of the problem in an acceptable manner, quickly. I later bought a different type of plant from them and it was a good specimen too
customer_reviews.author: KPR

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, bright green
customer_reviews.text: 7/8/17 received today, Very healthy nice looking plant of generous size. Grown onto coconut husk well, will not be coming off of it, which was the perfect size to weight down with gravel without burying the roots. We will see how she is in a month 8/10/17 Plant is still looking great, even has sprouted new growth. Very happy with this plant.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Penton

customer_reviews.title: I ordered two of these plants. They arrived quickly ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these plants. They arrived quickly but one was dead and the other was mostly dead. I managed to salvage one by cutting off most of the dead leaves. I'm afraid to buy any more.
customer_reviews.author: Mira

customer_reviews.title: Turned Brown
customer_reviews.text: leaves did not survive like my other Java Ferns... turned brown and separated from holder
customer_reviews.author: Karen Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Could've been better...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of the java ferns. They were sent in the box with other things that were ordered. They were smashed. Once i opened them, one plant was big and had several leaves while the other, not as many. The smaller one has more brownish/blackish leaves. I'm honestly feeling as if this one won't sprout as quickly. It just doesn't look as healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Coco Elle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Not like silk at all
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Not like silk at all. Stiff with jagged edges. Leaves are glued on. Might be good for a lizard or turtle set up, but not fish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sad, brown and wilted bag of mush.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I thought it would be a good idea to buy plants through the internet. What I got was a wilted brown mass in a plastic bag. That are nothing but brown twigs in my tank now. Note that the actual green plants I bought at the local pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie L.

customer_reviews.title: Go to a pet store
customer_reviews.text: No air holes were left for this plant to breath so it arrived to my house brown and dead. Go purchase a live plant from a pet store. Shame on me for making this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Nalesnik

customer_reviews.title: RIP OFF ALERT!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived black and completely dead. When I opened the bag I almost lost my lunch, the rotting smell was so putrid I had to throw away immediately. This is a total rip off as I have no way to return a mushy smelly lump of decay.
customer_reviews.author: Patric

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Goldfish Tank
customer_reviews.text: Plant arrived quickly and in perfect condition. Set it in my 40 gallon breeder Goldfish tank. Nice looking addition to aquascape. This is one of the plants that Goldfish tend not to eat. I had the plant for over 2 weeks and is still doing nicely. I've been doing a twice weekly addition of Seachem Flourish fertilizer. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A.

customer_reviews.title: I just hope it starts growing so its not a waste of
customer_reviews.text: Ugliest plant i ordered in the mail. All leaves has bites of insect or something. Browning. They are not bright green. I just hope it starts growing so its not a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Go to Pet Smart to get your plants
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. Go to Pet Smart to get your plants.
customer_reviews.author: kumla

customer_reviews.title: Came in brown and rotten!
customer_reviews.text: Order on August 10th, shipped on August 14, received today (August 17). Came in a two layer plastic bag, moisturized and warm! The leaves are all brown, and the stems rotten. Original delivery was scheduled yesterday, but received an delayed notice instead. Very disappointed, first time buying live aquarium plant on line, turns out to be waste of money. For others who still considering buying, you may want to avoid ordering in the hot summer.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. I would advise highly against it. My plant came in brown on a Friday. I put it in the tank to see if it would come back to life. Well it didn’t so that Sunday I sent them a message saying that it was dead and I would like a new plant. Well they won’t respond to my messages or respond to any of my message. So I’m out the money. This Internet robbery. I will never buy again. I wish I could give negative stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dano643

customer_reviews.title: Sad to see this product arrive with just 2 leaves ...
customer_reviews.text: All the leaves were brown (and they sky was grey). Sad to see this product arrive with just 2 leaves attached to the husk, the rest were detached, and all the leaves were brown and dead. I've placed it in water anyway, hoping the rhizomes will generate new growth, but am doubtful.
customer_reviews.author: lucas123

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Received these and they were about 80% brown and dried out. Get your aquarium plants from a local store or pet store, they will be in much better condition.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: dead. all the leaves were dead. there werr ...
customer_reviews.text: dead. all the leaves were dead. there werr about a dozen leaves on the thing, all brown, and about 2 made it into the tank. can't say I'm not surprised. guess that's what I get for trying to order a live plant online
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: My plant is almost dead, barely hanging on to live.
customer_reviews.author: G. Sahagun

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know if this item froze during shipment but ...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if this item froze during shipment but it is officially dead. It was not a vibrant green when it arrived but I assumed that would change once I got it in the tank. I will try something different from the local fish store.
customer_reviews.author: Bart  B

customer_reviews.title: Great easy plant!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these, and they are all very healthy and large. They drop right into the tank and start growing immediately. My little betas love hiding in them. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Wehmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Small box of nope.
customer_reviews.text: I have rarely seen a plant so dead that I just spent money on. The fern was....cooked. Warm to the touch even. The moss was only half dead. So thats a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Luffy Coco Philippines Java Fern: Live Aquatic Plant with 10+ Leaves : Provides a Natural Environment for Your Fish: Easy Care: Hardy Plant with Longevity: Bring More Color to Your Aquascape
